discoveredAssets: localhost:8080 - Trading Platform (Flask/Werkzeug 3.1.3 Python/3.13.3) - HTTP service on port 8080
/ - Root login endpoint - Accepts POST with username parameter
/password/{username} - Parameterized password verification endpoint - Critical for authentication bypass testing
/dashboard - Authenticated dashboard - Requires JWT token, shows user information
/logout - Session termination endpoint - POST method required

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass via SQL injection, NoSQL injection, and username enumeration on the login form. Test for CSRF vulnerabilities on POST requests. Test for default credentials and weak password policies.
targets.rationale: Root login endpoint accepts POST requests with username parameter. Initial attack surface for authentication testing. Redirects reveal whether username exists (user enumeration vulnerability).

targets.objective: Test IDOR/privilege escalation by accessing other users' password pages. Test for authentication bypass (SQL injection, NoSQL injection, authentication bypass). Test for user enumeration via error messages. Test password policy and brute force protections.
targets.rationale: CRITICAL: Parameterized endpoint reveals user information and accepts user_id from client-side hidden form fields. User enumeration possible via 'User not found' vs password form responses. Known test account with weak credentials (test:test). Client-side user_id manipulation may allow horizontal privilege escalation (IDOR).

targets.objective: Test session management flaws, authentication validation, IDOR vulnerabilities, and authorization bypasses. Identify additional authenticated endpoints. Test for token/session manipulation.
targets.rationale: Authenticated endpoint showing sensitive user information. Cookie-based authentication with JWT tokens. Potential for session fixation, token prediction, or authorization flaws. Gateway to testing authenticated application functionality.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] HTML comment in source reveals testing account credentials: test:test - Found in root login page
[CRITICAL] Parameterized /password/{username} endpoint enables user enumeration via error messages - 'User not found' vs password form returned
[HIGH] Client-side user_id field (value=10032) in hidden form - Potential for IDOR/privilege escalation if server trusts client-provided user_id
[HIGH] User information leaked in password form - Displays full name ('John') after username lookup, aids attacker reconnaissance
[HIGH] No apparent rate limiting on password endpoint - Enables brute force attacks and user enumeration at scale
[MEDIUM] Two-stage authentication can be partially bypassed - Username lookup stage reveals user existence without password verification
[MEDIUM] Logout endpoint only accepts POST but lacks apparent CSRF token validation - Potential CSRF vulnerability
[MEDIUM] Bootstrap 4.5.2 CSS file publicly accessible - No sensitive info but confirms front-end technology stack
[MEDIUM] JWT tokens visible in Set-Cookie headers - May allow token analysis and weakness identification
[LOW] No robots.txt, sitemap.xml, or API documentation endpoints found - Suggests limited REST API surface area or poor documentation practices
